intro: Chailletia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan chailletia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
